document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements who conduct testing or development activities

control.control_purpose: To ensure relevance of testing and protection of operational information used for testing through appropriate selection, protection and management
control.control_objective: Establish procedures for selecting, protecting and managing test data to prevent unauthorized disclosure, modification or loss while ensuring test validity

iso_27001_definition.official_text: Test information should be appropriately selected, protected and managed.
key_requirements: Test data appropriately selected for testing
Test data protected from unauthorized access
Test data protected from unauthorized modification
Test data protected from unauthorized loss
Synthetic or masked data preferred over production data
Production data in test only when necessary
Secure deletion of test data after testing

control_purpose_detail.purpose: Preventive control protecting test data from unauthorized disclosure, modification or loss while ensuring test results are valid and reliable
scope: Test data used in quality assurance
Test data used in security testing
Test data used in performance testing
Test data used in user acceptance testing
Test data used in integration testing
control_purpose_detail.key_outcome: Test environments use appropriate test data that is protected with controls equivalent to production data, with preference for synthetic or masked data rather than production data

prerequisites.description: Before implementing test information controls, foundational requirements must be in place

required_prerequisites.description: Data classification scheme identifying sensitive and confidential data
required_prerequisites.rationale: Determines what data can be used for testing
Test data must be isolated in separate environment
required_prerequisites.reference: ISO 27001 A 8.31 - Separation of development, test and production environments

required_prerequisites.description: Access control mechanisms and identity management
required_prerequisites.rationale: Controls who can access test data
Test data subject to same regulatory requirements
required_prerequisites.reference: ISO 27001 A 5.2 - Information security risk assessment

required_prerequisites.rationale: Defines what test data is needed
required_prerequisites.reference: ISO 27001 A 8.29 - Security testing in development and acceptance

test_information_overview.definition: Data and information used in testing environments selected, protected and managed to ensure testing validity while preventing unauthorized disclosure or misuse
test_information_overview.core_principle: Never use production data for testing unless absolutely necessary and protected with equivalent or greater controls

test_data_types.description: Artificially generated data that mimics production data structure but contains no real information
advantages: Can be generated at any scale

test_data_types.description: Production-like data where sensitive elements replaced with fake values
advantages: Better test coverage than pure synthetic

test_data_types.description: Actual production data used for testing
restrictions: Shorter retention period than masked data

test_data_selection_principles: Prefer synthetic data - no risk of disclosure
Use masked/anonymized data if synthetic insufficient
Production data only as last resort
Ensure test data relevance to testing objectives
Ensure sufficient data volume for valid testing
Ensure data diversity for comprehensive testing

implementation_requirements.description: Create formal policy governing selection, protection and management of test data

policy_elements: Types of data allowed in test environments
Preference for synthetic or masked data
When production data may be used
Approval process for production data use

implementation_requirements.description: Use tools and procedures to generate realistic synthetic test data

synthetic_data_approach: Scale synthetic data for testing needs
synthetic_data_validation: Verify data types and formats correct

implementation_requirements.description: Use techniques and tools to mask or anonymize sensitive elements of test data

masking_techniques: Field masking - replacing values with realistic fakes
sensitive_data_elements: Social security numbers or tax IDs

implementation_requirements.description: Implement access controls for test data equivalent to or exceeding production controls

access_restrictions: Restrict access to test environment personnel
Restrict access by time of day if appropriate

implementation_requirements.description: Encrypt test data containing sensitive information both in transit and at rest

encryption_in_transit: Encrypt during data transfer between environments
key_management: Storage of keys separately from data

implementation_requirements.description: Define secure procedures for moving test data between environments

transfer_controls: Use secure file transfer protocols (SFTP, SCP)

implementation_requirements.description: Implement procedures for secure deletion of test data after testing completion

deletion_procedures: Define retention period for test data

implementation_requirements.description: Ensure test environment network completely segregated from production

segregation_controls: VLAN segregation if on same physical network

implementation_requirements.requirement: Ensure Compliance with Data Protection Regulations
implementation_requirements.description: Apply data protection regulations to test data equivalent to production data

data_subject_rights: Right to access - test data subject to access requests
Right to erasure - delete test data on request
Right to rectification - correct test data errors
Right to data portability - provide test data on request

implementation_requirements.description: Maintain comprehensive documentation of test data and procedures

implementation_requirements.requirement: Implement Monitoring and Logging for Test Data Access
implementation_requirements.description: Monitor access to test data and maintain audit logs

monitoring_controls: Log all access to test data
Log all modifications to test data

implementation_requirements.requirement: Manage Production Data Use in Testing
implementation_requirements.description: If production data must be used, implement enhanced controls and risk management

production_data_justification: Document business case for production data
risk_management: Risk assessment of production data use

steps.detail: Create formal policy for test data selection, protection and management
Deploy tools and procedures for synthetic test data
Deploy tools and procedures for masking sensitive data
Implement role-based access to test data
Encrypt test data at rest and in transit
Define secure procedures for test data transfers
Define secure deletion of test data after use
Ensure test environment isolated from production
Monitor access to test data and maintain audit logs
Document all procedures and train staff

compliance_checklist.description: Steps to comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 8.33

checklist.item: Access controls for test data in place
Monitoring and logging of test data access
No production data in test without approval
Regular audits of test data controls
Personnel trained on test data procedures
Documentation of all test data activities

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with test information

mistakes.mistake: Using production data for testing without masking or protection
mistakes.description: Production data including customer information, payment data, or RNG secrets copied to test environment without masking or encryption
root_cause: Convenience - easier to use real data
Lack of masking tools or procedures
Belief that test environment is safe
prevention: Access controls on production data in test
mistakes.requirement: Production data must never be used in test without masking or strong justification and controls

mistakes.mistake: Test data retained indefinitely after testing completed
mistakes.description: Test data left in test environment long after testing completed, creating unnecessary data breach risk
root_cause: Belief that test environment is isolated

mistakes.mistake: Test data accessible by unauthorized personnel
mistakes.description: Test data accessible to developers, contractors or personnel without need for access

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 8.33 audit

checks: Production data use justified and approved
No unmasked production data in test

audit_areas.description: Verify access to test data restricted appropriately
Verify secure procedures for test data transfer
Verify test data deleted after testing
Verify test environment segregated from production
Verify compliance with data protection regulations
checks: Data subject rights procedures in place

audit_areas.description: Verify monitoring and documentation in place

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: For gambling operators, test data for RNG systems, game outcomes and customer data requires highest protection. Unmasked test data containing RNG algorithms or customer payment information creates significant breach and regulatory risk.

requirements: Never use actual RNG algorithms in test
Use test RNG algorithms separate from production
No RNG seeds or secrets in test data
Separate test RNG from production RNG
Access restricted to authorized personnel
Encrypted storage and transfer
Immediate deletion after testing
Use synthetic game outcomes for testing
Mask any production outcome data if necessary
Segregated test outcome recording
No production outcomes in test
Audit trail of test outcomes
Quick deletion after testing
Mandatory masking of customer names and addresses
Mandatory masking of email and contact info
No payment card numbers in test
Tokenization of customer identifiers
Encryption of any masked customer data
GDPR compliance for test data
Restricted access to necessary personnel
No real payment card data in test
Use test payment card numbers only
Mask or tokenize payment data
PCI DSS compliance for test data
Encryption of test payment data
Quick deletion after testing

regulatory_expectations: Regular audits of test data controls

test_data_for_gambling_systems.guidance: Use separate test RNG algorithm, never test with production RNG. No RNG seeds or state information in test environment. Encrypted storage of test RNG.
Use synthetic game outcomes for testing. If production outcomes necessary, mask customer identifiers and game session details. Segregated storage.
Mandatory masking of all personal identifiers. No payment card numbers. Encryption of any remaining sensitive data. Restricted access.
Test payment card numbers only, never real cards. Tokenization of payment data. PCI DSS compliance. Quick deletion after testing.

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Ensure test data selected appropriately and protected to prevent unauthorized disclosure while ensuring test validity and regulatory compliance
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: High - test environments are common entry points for data breaches if test data not protected
key_principles: Prefer synthetic data - no real data at risk
Use masked data if synthetic insufficient
Production data only as last resort with controls
Protect test data equivalent to production
Restrict access to necessary personnel only
Delete test data promptly after use

to_pass_the_audit.description: To comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 8.33, implement

requirements.detail: Documented policy governing test data selection and protection
Procedures and tools for creating synthetic test data
Procedures and tools for masking sensitive data elements
Role-based access to test data with authentication
Encryption of test data at rest and in transit
Documented procedures for secure data transfer
Documented procedures for secure deletion after use
Logging and monitoring of test data access
If used, justify and apply enhanced controls
GDPR and data protection compliance for test data
Documentation and regular audits of procedures

related_iso_controls: ISO 27001 A 8.29 - Security testing in development and acceptance
ISO 27001 A 8.31 - Separation of development, test and production environments
ISO 27001 A 8.34 - Protection of information systems during audit testing

data_selection: Default to synthetic data for all testing
Use masked data if synthetic insufficient
Minimize production data volume if necessary
Use data subsets rather than full production
encryption: Encrypt all test data at rest
deletion: Immediate deletion after testing if possible

rng_test_data_management.guidance: Develop separate test RNG distinct from production. Use test RNG exclusively in test environment. Never share production RNG with test environment.
Encrypt all test RNG data. Restrict access to authorized cryptography personnel. Immediately delete after testing.
Completely segregate test RNG from production RNG. No network paths between environments. Separate systems if possible.

game_outcome_test_data.guidance: Generate synthetic game outcomes that mimic production structure but contain no real customer or game data. Sufficient volume for testing.
If production outcomes necessary for testing, mask all customer identifiers and game session information. Tokenize where applicable.
Encrypt test outcome data. Restrict access. Delete after testing complete.

customer_data_test_data.guidance: Mandatory masking of customer names, addresses, emails, phone numbers. All personally identifiable information masked.
Never include real payment card numbers in test data. Use test card numbers. Tokenize payment identifiers.
Test data containing personal information subject to GDPR. Minimize collection of personal data for testing. Delete after testing.

test_data_audit_focus: Verify no unmasked production data in test
Verify no RNG secrets or algorithms in test
Verify encryption of sensitive test data
Verify access controls restrict unauthorized access
Verify deletion of test data after use
Verify segregation of test and production
Verify monitoring of test data access
